What kind of jobs can I do as a student at UTN?

You can work as a student/research assistant at the university (supporting research/teaching) or in administration. Alternatively, you can take a mini-job or part-time job with a company, ideally related to your studies.

How many hours can I work per week as an international student?
During lectures, your work is limited to 20 hours per week to prioritize your studies. Your monthly hours depend on your hourly wage.

What’s the difference between a mini-job and a part-time job?
A mini-job pays up to €520/month with no social security contributions, while a part-time job may exceed €520 but requires paying taxes and social security.

Do I need to file a tax return as a student?
It’s voluntary but recommended if you’ve paid income tax—you might get a refund. The process is complex, so consider consulting the tax office or a advisor.

What’s a tax ID (Steuer-ID), and how do I get it?
Your tax ID is assigned when you register in Germany and stays the same forever. If you lose it, you can request it again electronically.

When does my employer deduct income tax?
If you earn over €520/month, your employer automatically withholds income tax (wage tax) based on your income and tax bracket.

Church tax is deducted only if you’re a registered member of a church in Germany. Otherwise, it doesn’t apply to you.
